title: Enhancement: Varargs in assertThat and method isOnlyValueIn and multiGet of List
body:
I have test which checks selected rows for "status green". After some operation say 3 distinct rows are green.
I have `List<String> allRows ` with row values
test so far is checking:
```
allRows.get(1).contains(status_green) &&
allRows.get(3).contains(status_green) &&
allRows.get(4).contains(status_green) == true
```
So to remove redundancy, i can do something like:
`asssertThat(status_green).isIn(allRows.get(1),allRows.get(3),allRows.get(4))`
but this is **wrong** because this would have to be **isOnlyValueIn** (can this be added?)
i can reverse it into ugly but working:
`assertThat(Arrays.asList({allRows.get(1)..get(3)..get(4)}).containsOnly(status_green)`
So is there any chance to have **varargs assertThat** like (example with plain integers) 
`assertThat(1,2,3).containsOnly(1);`
But my problem also lies in those repeated gets. Some **multiGet** would be great. Like 
`assertThat(allRows).get/filter(1,3,4).containsOnly...`
_(This stays in AssertJ domain and I could not find library with List allowing multiGet)_
